intro: Drypetes afzelii, commonly known as the African flame tree, is a deciduous tree native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its smooth, grayish bark and distinctive, palmate leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in spherical inflorescences, followed by bright red, berry-like fruits. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soils, often found in savannah and woodland areas. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and parks in tropical and subtropical regions.
